Boots- Schiffswerft Cuxhaven GmbH The shipyard is located upstream on the ‘Schleusenpriel’ between the Elbe and the city centre, this location is very important historic water connection. The boat and dockyard is subsidiary of Plambeck Holding AG based Cuxhaven. Plambeck Holding AG owns and develops subsidiaries the following sectors: Construction Technology, Project and Software Development, Shipping industries and Wind and Solar Energies. The Holding company supports its subsidiaries funding, administration, judiciaries and the sharing of contacts. It identifies synergistic effects for the benefit of the whole group and it opens up new business fields and investment opportunities for its companies. How to find us Directions Take the A27 and leave at the very last exit (Cuxhaven). At the roundabout take the 3rd exit for the Papenstraße towards Cuxhaven. Follow the road for approx. 920 meters and pass the city entrance to Cuxhaven. From Papenstraße the street changes name to the Grodener Chaussee and continue going straight . You have to follow the street for 2.5 kilometers. Pass the ‘Real’ super market and turn right at the next set of traffic lights into the Kapitän-Alexander-Straße. After about 70 meters you reach the shipyard. It is on the left hand side of the road. Ganzjährig verfügbar Citymarina Mit idyllischer , innenstädtischer Hafenatmosphäre bietet City-Marina ganzjährig Gastplätze Schwimmstegen. Für Festlieger Dauerplätze vorhanden. Das Hafenmeisterbüro sanitäre Anlagen befinden Ende Hafenbeckens. In unmittelbarer Hafennähe, attraktive Restaurant Kneipen Auswahl. Die Cuxhavener Innenstadt 5 Minuten Fuß erreichen. Service, Schiffsausrüstung, Kran- Slipanlage liegen unmittelbarer Nähe Boots- Schiffswerft Cuxhaven. Die Einfahrt erfolgt "Alten Hafen". Ihr Partner für Bootsbau, Yachtservice, Schiffbau, Reparaturen Schlosserarbeiten Die Schiffswerft Der Standort heutigen Boots- Schiffswerft 1945 etabliert. Während Hochzeit Nordseefischerei Cuxhavener Bootswerft Neubauten Krabbenkuttern Namen. Im Herbst 2001 Werft Boots- Schiffswerft Cuxhaven GmbH umfirmiert trat neuer Mannschaft an. Das heutige Spektrum Werft vielfältig. Die Slipanlage, renoviert Umweltauflagen angepasst, bietet Schiffen maximal 300 Tonnen, 35 Länge 9,90 Breite preisgünstigen Weg Trockene. Im Außengelände stehen sowohl Baukran, 10-Tonnen-Mobilkran 16to Drehkran zur Verfügung, für schwere Lasten externer Mobilkran direkt Werfthalle Slipbahn eingesetzt. Die Werfthalle hingegen bietet Voraussetzungen für Schlosserarbeiten Art. In central location on the historic Ritzebüttler Schleusenpriel, the Marina offers 100 mooring places for boats up to 30m length and draft of 4.50m. Cuxhaven city center is mere 5 minute walk from our location. The City Marina is reached by bascule bridge. Commercial Ships & Metalwork - Yachtservice Schiffbau Home Boatbuilding & Yachtservice Commercial Ships & Metalwork Services Projects References Contact person 2nd hand Location Boots- Schiffswerft Cuxhaven GmbH Kapitän-Alexander-Str. 21-23 27472 Cuxhaven Phone: +49 47 21 / 399 00-0 Fax: +49 47 21 / 399 00-99 Your partner for boat building, yacht service, ship building, repair and metalwork. The Boat yard The current location of the boat and ship yard established 1945. During the peak time of North Sea fishing the shipyard built up very good reputation with constructing new shrimp trawlers. In autumn 2001 the shipyard rebranded and appeared with new team. Today the spectrum of work and services offered are manifold. The slipway renovated and adjusted to latest environmental regulations. It offers boats (maximum 300 tons, 35m length and 9.90m width) affordable way to dry dock. The area outside offers construction crane, 10-tons-mobile-crane and 16 ton derrick crane. For heavy burdens there is external mobile crane front of the hall of the shipyard, as well as slipway. The shipyard hall is equipped to deal with all kinds of metalwork. Regardless of whether it is boat building, classical steel works or repairs to construction machines, we are good partner every sense of the word! Boatbuilding and Yachtservice Since 1945 shipbuilding, repair and maintenance has taken place on our premises the City Marina Cuxhaven. In 2002 modern complex of buildings were constructed. The workshops and office building were modernized and extended. A multipurpose hall with area of 500m² and entrance height of 7m built. It has dual function - It is used for treating and varnishing yachts and boats and for the storage of yachts dry and warm environment. An open space of 500m² for storage exists onshore. A slewing (swing) crane lifts boats up to 16 tons ashore. Heavier boats are hoisted out of water with mobile crane directly front of the shipyard hall.
